text:
October 23rd, 1950
Mr. Ralph Steetle
W L S U
Louisiana State University
Baton Rouge, Louisiana
Dear Ralph:
Thanks for putting together all the correspondence and all
of the difficulties involved in Leg 4 of the University of
Chicago Roundtable. Thank goodness Leg 4 is the only one
which has been productive of so much change and cross-change
and what have you.
This all comes about because of having too many cooks in the
pie. Everybody, in an effort to be helpful, made various and
sundry arrangements, but in many instances failed to notify
all parties concerned.
Gaines apparently has been operating under a letter of
August l&th from Dunn. You have been dperating under our
memo of August 23rd.
I presume, therefore, that the present schedule which is
apparently working out satisfactorily for you and Ausmus
should be in effect, i.e., NBC to WLSU to WUOA to WAB3.
Gaines, at WABE, is to forward the tape back to jJrobst
in Chicago.
Ifll be seeing you at Leatington, I hope, at which time we
can commiserate with each other, and use your stack of
correspondence as a shining example (because it is the
only one of snafu).
As ever,
Seymour N. Siegel
Director
sns :L
cc to Alvin Gaines, WABE; GRAYDON AUSMUS, WUOA; George
Probst, University of Chicago
